    android.arch.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, android.arch.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback, android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompat.RequestPermissionsRequestCodeValidator, android.support.v4.app.TaskStackBuilder.SupportParentable, android.support.v4.view.KeyEventDispatcher.Component, android.support.v7.app.ActionBarDrawerToggle.DelegateProvider, android.support.v7.app.AppCompatCallback, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MainActivity, MonitorBleDeviceActivity, ScanBleDeviceActivity, ScanGattServiceActivity, SelectCharacteristicActivity

    public class BluetoothLeBaseActivity
extends android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity
    BluetoothLeBaseActivity is a base activity for all activities that use Bluetooth Low Energy feature.

      • mBluetoothLeService

      • mBluetoothLeServiceBindActivity

        protected static BluetoothLeBaseActivity mBluetoothLeServiceBindActivity
        There is only one BluetoothLeBaseActivity being bound with BluetoothLeService, which is a Service wrapping and managing BLE APIs provided by Android SDK. Do not modified this attribute. It is managed by this class.

      • mActivityCount

        static int mActivityCount

      • mBluetoothLeServiceConnection

        private static final android.content.ServiceConnection mBluetoothLeServiceConnection

      • mBluetoothLeServiceBroadcastReceiver

        private final android.content.BroadcastReceiver mBluetoothLeServiceBroadcastReceiver
        BluetoothLeBaseActivity only receives Intent of which the action is BluetoothLeService.ACTION_BLUETOOTH_ENABLED_REQUIRED or BluetoothLeService.ACTION_INITIALIZATION_FAILURE. Activities that extend from this class can register their own BroadcastReceiver to receive more Intent from mBluetoothLeService. When BluetoothLeService.ACTION_BLUETOOTH_ENABLED_REQUIRED is received, this class will send a request to the system for enabling Bluetooth.

        public BluetoothLeBaseActivity()

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(@Nullable
                        android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity

      • onResume

        protected void onResume()
        BluetoothLeBaseActivity will check permissions related to Bluetooth and start up a BluetoothLeService if permission check passes. Besides, it also register a broadcast receiver to receive intent from mBluetoothLeService.
        Overrides:
        onResume in class android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity

      • onPause

        protected void onPause()
        Unregister the broadcast receiver when paused.
        Overrides:
        onPause in class android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity

      • onDestroy

        protected void onDestroy()
        When the final instance of BluetoothLeBaseActivity is going to be destroyed, mBluetoothLeService should be stopped and unbind. And mBluetoothLeServiceBindActivity will be assigned null. So, please make sure that all activities using BLE extend from BluetoothLeBaseActivity.
        Overrides:
        onDestroy in class android.support.v7.app.AppCompatActivity

      • onActivityResult

        protected void onActivityResult(int requestCode,
                                int resultCode,
                                @Nullable
                                android.content.Intent data)
        If the user denies to open Bluetooth, all the following procedures cannot be executed. So, BluetoothLeBaseActivity will finish itself.
        Overrides:
        onActivityResult in class android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
        Parameters:
        requestCode - int: The integer request code originally supplied to startActivityForResult(), allowing you to identify who this result came from.
        resultCode - int: The integer result code returned by the child activity through its setResult().
        data - Intent: An Intent, which can return result data to the caller (various data can be attached to Intent "extras").

      • onRequestPermissionsResult

        public void onRequestPermissionsResult(int requestCode,
                                       @NonNull
                                       java.lang.String[] permissions,
                                       @NonNull
                                       int[] grantResults)
        If one of the permissions is not granted, BluetoothLeBaseActivity will try to request it over and over again until the permission is granted.
        Specified by:
        onRequestPermissionsResult in interface android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompat.OnRequestPermissionsResultCallback
        Overrides:
        onRequestPermissionsResult in class android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
        Parameters:
        requestCode - int: The request code passed in requestPermissions(String[], int).
        permissions - String: The requested permissions. Never null.
        grantResults - int: The grant results for the corresponding permissions which is either PackageManager.PERMISSION_GRANTED or PackageManager.PERMISSION_DENIED. Never null.

      • checkPermissions

        void checkPermissions()
        Check permissions and request those un-granted permissions. When all the required permissions are granted, mBluetoothLeService will be started up.

      • startBluetoothLeService

        private void startBluetoothLeService()
        Only start up a BluetoothLeService if mBluetoothLeService is null.

      • makeIntentFilter

        private android.content.IntentFilter makeIntentFilter()
        Make an IntentFilter for mBluetoothLeServiceBroadcastReceiver.
        Returns:
        An IntentFilter with BluetoothLeService.ACTION_BLUETOOTH_ENABLED_REQUIRED and BluetoothLeService.ACTION_INITIALIZATION_FAILURE inside.
